results.title: The Haunting
results.brief_description: The Haunting directed by Robert Wise is a horror film. With impressive black and white cinematography and without the use of big special effects this is a fine example of a haunted house horror film. As an experiment on haunted houses an academic selects ‘receptive’ participants to take part in a study in supernatural phenomenon. Two being female and one who happens to be the inheritor on the house in question. There is an underlying lesbian tension between the female couple who are terrified and drawn together by the extremely frightening and inexplicable movements of the house. The film is a gripping and very well made horror film without high tech special effects. Cast includes Julie Harris, Claire Blood, Richard Johnson and Russ Tamblyn.

results.title: The Harvey girls
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Arthur Freed and George Sidney
results.brief_description: It is the end of the nineteenth century and the future lies in the wild west. Judy Garland is a young woman attracted to the work opportunities along the great Sante Fe railway. Of all opportunities available there is none more alluring than Frank Harvey’s chain of hotels and restaurants. Making her way out west she joins Anglea Lansbury, Marjorie Main, Cyd Charisse and a great Hollywood cast to become one of the “Harvey Girls”. This opulent and sunny film is a great example of the Hollywood musical genre and features an outstanding musical score by Johnny Mercer and Harry Warren (songs include “Oh, You Kid”, “On the Atchison”, “Topeka and the Santa Fe”). Cast also includes John Hodiak, Ray Bolger, Preston S. Foster.

results.title: The Harder they fall
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Philip Yordan and Mark Robson
results.brief_description: Eddie Willis is an unemployed newspaperman who sells his soul when he takes on the job of press agent for corrupt boxing promoter, Nick Benko. Willis takes on the task of stirring up publicity for Benko’s newest protege, the clumsy, seven-foot giant, Toro Moreno, who can’t box to save himself. Toro quickly rises to the top through a series of fixed fights, and believes himself a killer not recognising the scam. Willis regains some integrity, however, when he learns that Benko has no intention of paying Toro his share of winnings. He sends Toro home with his own share, and decides to expose the scandal through a series of articles. Cast includes: Humphrey Bogart, Rod Steiger, Jan Stirling, Mike Lane and Max Baer.

results.title: The Harder they come [DVD]
results.brief_description: The first independent feature film produced in Jamaica gave many Americans their first taste of reggae music with musician Jimmy Cliff in the title role, backed by a fabulous reggae soundtrack. Cliff plays Ivan, a naive rural singer who moves to the city in search of fame but is soon impoverished and exploited by the music industry before becoming embroiled in the trade of marijuana and murder; simultaneously Ivan’s music is released to great acclaim and he becomes somewhat of a local anti-hero. As well as offering a unique view of the reggae scene the milieu of this film also offers a de-romanticised view of seedy Kingston life. Indeed Henzell’s style borders on documentary, as he evokes the squalor of the street, the impoverishment of the people and the multi-faceted systemic corruption. Soundtrack includes the title track as well as other reggae hits “You Can Really Get It if You Want It”, “Sitting in Limbo” and “Johnny Too Bad”. Cast includes Basil Keane, Ras Daniel Hartman, Winston Stona, Janet Barkley, Bobby Charlton and Carl Bradshaw.

results.title: The Hard word
results.creator_credit: Film Finance Corporation Australia, Al Clark and Scott Roberts
results.brief_description: Taking its cues from the harder edged of the classic crime genre spectrum (in particular Stanley Kubrick’s The Killing), writer/director Scott Robert’s The Hard word manages to work into the mix some off the wall humour and quirky characterization. Guy Pearce, Joel Edgerton and Damien Richardson star as the Twentyman brothers Dale, Mal and Shane, three hardened criminals serving out a prison sentence for armed robbery. Aided by their very crooked lawyer Frank Malone (a gleefully corrupt Robert Taylor), the brothers are given an early bail release, with one very compromising proviso, they have to pull off a dangerous casino heist. To complicate things further Frank is having an affair with Dale’s wife Carol (played with slutty abandon by Rachel Griffiths). Naturally things go from bad to worse as the heist takes a violent turn and the boys discover that they are being tailed by two dodgy cops (Vince Colossimo and Paul Sonkkila) with an unlawful agenda of their own. Cast includes: Rhondda Findleton, Kym Gyngell, Kate Atkinson.

results.title: The Handmaid's tale
results.creator_credit: Cinecom Entertainment Group, Daniel Wilson and Volker Schlondorff
results.brief_description: In the near future, the air and water is poisoned, the result is sterility. Only one out of a hundred women can still bear children and some women stopped, believing there would be no future. The solution; to create an army of ‘handmaids’, an involuntary, semi-religious order of women who exist solely to bear children for the rich, powerful ruling class. Kate (Natasha Richardson) becomes a victim of this cruel and backward world, where women are divided into three kinds, Handmaids, Wives or Prostitutes. A chilling look at a possible future. Based on the novel by Margaret Atwood. Screenplay by Harold Pinter. Cast also includes Victoria Tennant, Faye Dunaway, Elizabeth McGovern, Aidan Quinn and Robert Duvall.

results.title: The Hairdresser's husband = Le Mari del la coiffeuse
results.creator_credit: Lambart Productions, TFI and Patrice Leconte
results.brief_description: Death is yellow and smells of vanilla pronounces Antoine, the protagonist of this sunny and optimistic film in which even something sombre is imagined as radiant and sweet. Photographed in glowing primary colours, with some scenes shot in slight slow-motion, this study of male erotic obsession is a lazy, dreamy film about nothing more than a state of being - happiness. Cocooned in their little one-roomed store, Antoine and Mathilde, his luminous wife are sufficient to themselves. Two wonderful performances from Jean Rochefort and Anna Galiena are complemented by the Arab music Antoine loves and original music by Michael Nyman.

results.title: The Guns of Navarone
results.creator_credit: Columbia, Open Road Films, Cecil F. Ford and J Thompson
results.brief_description: The suspense builds and the drama explodes in J. Lee Thompson’s finely crafted adaptation of Alistair MacLean’s best-selling novel. Gregory Peck, Anthony Quinn, David Niven, and Anthony Quayle are allied saboteurs, assigned an impossible mission - infiltrate an impregnable Nazi-held island and destroy two enormous long-range field guns that prevent the rescue of 2000 trapped British soldiers. Honoured with seven Academy Award nominations, receiving the Oscar for Best Special Effects, this film is still regarded as one of the greatest action-adventure spectacles ever produced.

results.title: The Grifters
results.creator_credit: Cineplex Odeon Films, Martin Scorsese, Robert A. Harris, Jim Painten and Stephen Frears
results.brief_description: Set in the sleazy horse-tracks and gambling dens of contemporary L.A., “The Grifters” is a modern crime film that compares favourably to classic Hollywood film-noir films. Based on Jim Thompson’s pulp classic of the same name, this film shimmers with a consistent erotic tension. John Cusack is Roy, a young con-man who makes easy money off the gullible hordes that crowd Los Angeles. He finds himself caught in the middle of a dangerous tug-of-war between his prostitute girlfriend (Annette Bening) who wants him to committ a major scam, and his elegant but desperate mother, Lily (Angelica Huston), who has been hustling for years and wants to find a way out. Both are powerful women not adverse to using the people they love to get what they want, and their desperate machinations to achieve financial independance puts Roy’s very life at risk. This brilliantly directed film is a powerful study on the corrosive effects of power and money on human relationships. All the cast is outstanding but special mention must be made of the majestic Angelica Huston: her blazing and frightening performance as Lily is unforgettable.

results.title: The Green berets (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Batjac Productions, Warner Bros Pictures, Seven Arts, Michael Wayne, John Wayne and Ray Kellogg
results.brief_description: After extensive training, Colonel Michael Kirby selects two platoons from the U.S. Special forces - known as the Green Berets - for guerilla warfare at Anang. The soldiers are needed to widen the ‘killing zone’ around a Strike Camp in Viet Cong Territory. One of the most controversial movies about the Vietnamese Conflict, ‘Green berets’ stars John Wayne and David Janssen.
